newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bremen coffee market sees higher Brazil prices.
newsitem.headline: Bremen coffee market sees higher Brazil prices.

text.p: Brazil differentials in the German coffee import market rose as exporters raised prices as a result of firm domestic markets, traders said on Friday.
Sluggish roaster buying focused on first quarter 1997.
Fob Bremen Brazils were quoted at $124 per 50 kg compared with $116 charged last week for Sept/Nov.
Elsewhere, arabica prices rose $2-3 on the week in line with futures' net gains, although London and New York futures today took a weaker course after Thursday highs.
Indonesian robustas were reduced by $3 to $74.00 and competitive Ugandan robusta offers were also in the market.
